d19b92f899191e003a532ea9db496e82.canonical_title: Ukrainian Ice Climbing Influencer Dies in Fall

people.name: Eugene Vahin
people.injuries: Likely severe head injury and internal bleeding (per medical examiners relayed to spouse)

d19b92f899191e003a532ea9db496e82.summary: Eugene (Zhenya/Yevhen) Vahin, 33, died after an unroped fall while ice climbing at The Junkyards near Grassi Lakes in the Bow Valley, Alberta. After missing a planned 4:00 p.m. check-in on Jan. 23, his spouse searched the area and then called for help. RCMP and Kananaskis Mountain Rescue responded and located him deceased later that evening. According to his spouse, he had likely just finished filming near the top of a route when he slipped; the incident was not captured on his camera.

timeline.description: Last GoPro video timestamp; shows subject near edge of ice with nearby ground/grass.
Missed scheduled check-in call; spouse becomes concerned.
Spouse begins search, slips ~50 feet on icy slope but self-arrests on a tree; calls emergency services.
Same evening: RCMP and Kananaskis Mountain Rescue locate Vahin deceased and recover his body.

rescue.method: Body recovery after overdue report; Kananaskis Mountain Rescue extracted remains from terrain and transferred to RCMP.
rescue.staffing_notes: Four Kananaskis Mountain Rescue staff responded.
rescue.discovery_details: Distance of fall unknown; not captured on camera.

gear_condition_issues: one crampon returned without a strap (cause unknown)

uncertainties: Exact fall mechanism not captured on camera
Whether gear issues (e.g., missing crampon strap) contributed

cause_classification.narrative_summary: An unroped slip near the top of an ice route led to a fatal fall; familiarity with the ‘home’ crag and limited experience likely contributed. Other outlets did not provide mechanism details.

events.description: Climbing unroped near the top of an ice route while filming.
Unroped slip/fall; incident not captured on camera.
RCMP and Kananaskis Mountain Rescue respond to overdue report, locate and recover body.

quotes: "It seems to me that it was precisely the idea of this waterfall as ‘home’ and the easiest of all [the places] he climbed, that resulted in his fatal mistake." — Ekaterina Shurko
"From it you can see that he is standing on the edge of the ice, a meter away from him there is earth and grass. I suppose that this gave a false impression of safety." — Ekaterina Shurko
d19b92f899191e003a532ea9db496e82.notable_equipment_details: Victim was unroped; GoPro video ended at 3:44 p.m.; one crampon was returned without a strap (cause unknown).

Ice climber falls to their death near Canmore
Ice climber falls to death at Junkyards near Canmore

b6568f214eaaada0b66f823c190752ee.canonical_title: Three climbers killed, one survivor after rappel anchor failure on Early Winter Couloir, Washington Pass
b6568f214eaaada0b66f823c190752ee.accident_time_approx: Retreat decision around 5:30 p.m.; fall occurred during descent; survivor reported regaining consciousness around 10 p.m.

people.name: Anton Tselykh
people.injuries: Internal bleeding and traumatic brain injury; no broken bones reported

people.name: Vishnu Irigireddy
people.injuries: Severe head trauma and multiple leg fractures

people.name: Tim Nguyen
people.injuries: Severe head trauma and multiple leg fractures

people.name: Oleksander Martynenko
people.injuries: Severe head trauma and multiple leg fractures

b6568f214eaaada0b66f823c190752ee.summary: A party of four on Early Winter Couloir (AI3 M4+) in the Liberty Bell Group decided to retreat around 5:30 p.m. as weather moved in. During their rappel descent, the anchor reportedly failed, causing about a 200-foot near-vertical fall followed by an additional ~200-foot tumble in a rocky, partially snow-covered chute. Three climbers died from severe trauma. The survivor, Anton Tselykh, self-evacuated in darkness, ultimately reaching help after driving west over the pass; he is hospitalized with internal bleeding and a traumatic brain injury.
b6568f214eaaada0b66f823c190752ee.notable_equipment_details: Rope was found attached to a single, very weathered piton; the piton reportedly ripped from the rock. All four were attached to the same rope for descent. It is unclear if the anchor was backed up with additional protection.

rope_system.failure_description: Anchor blew while rappelling; all four fell simultaneously.

rescue_and_outcome.survivor_condition_notes: Traumatic brain injury and internal bleeding; hospitalized; initial refusal of medical attention reported

uncertainties_list: Whether the rappel anchor was backed up is unknown
Exact anchor build and sequence of failure unknown
Some reporting refers to the incident as occurring Sunday; primary source states Saturday, May 10

cause_classification.narrative_summary: A single, weathered piton reportedly failed during a late-day rappel retreat in approaching weather, causing a simultaneous fall of the roped party.

events.description: Halfway up Early Winter Couloir when weather moves in.
Team decides to retreat around 5:30 p.m. as a weather system moves in.
All four attached to the same rope for descent.
Anchor reportedly fails; ~200 ft fall then ~200 ft slide/tumble in a rocky, partially snow-covered chute.
Survivor loses consciousness, wakes around 10 p.m., crawls/hikes to car in darkness, drives west over the pass (collides with a guardrail en route) to seek help.
Bodies recovered by Snohomish County helicopter rescue team.

rescue_methods: Survivor self-evacuated on foot to vehicle; later drove to seek help
rescue.response_difficulties: Survivor disoriented after head injury; darkness; drove the wrong direction for help; did not use GPS communication devices.

b6568f214eaaada0b66f823c190752ee.timeline_text: ≈5:30 p.m.: Team halfway up the 1,100-ft Early Winter Couloir notices a storm and retreats. During the rappel descent the anchor fails; all four fall ~200 ft and tumble another ~200 ft. Survivor regains consciousness near 10 p.m., self-evacuates to car in darkness, drives west over the pass and eventually reaches help. SAR later recovers the three deceased by helicopter.
additional_notes: A fifth group member did not join this trip and filed the overdue/missing report.
Authorities confirmed the team carried appropriate technical gear for the route.

sources.article_title: Three Climbers Killed After 400-Foot Fall in Washington
Official says it's 'miraculous' climber survived fall off Washington mountain that killed 3 others
